law.catch_line: Promoting a sexual performance by a minor.

text.section: A person is guilty of promoting a sexual performance by a minor when, knowing the character and content thereof, he produces, directs or promotes any performance which includes sexual conduct by a minor.

Promoting a sexual performance by a minor is:
A Class C felony if the minor involved in the sexual performance is less than eighteen (18) years old at the time the minor engages in the prohibited activity;
A Class B felony if the minor involved in the sexual performance is less than sixteen (16) years old at the time the minor engages in the prohibited activity; and
A Class A felony if the minor involved in the sexual performance incurs physical injury thereby.

law.history: Amended 1986 Ky. Acts ch. 289, sec. 9, effective July 15, 1986. -- Created 1978 Ky. Acts ch. 219, sec. 4, effective June 17, 1978.
